0.title: MMA fighter Blake Perry's face disfigured after opponent breaks his nose, pic surfaces
0.article_body: US' 27-year-old MMA fighter Blake Perry's face was disfigured after having his nose shattered during his defeat to Marcel McCain in A1 Combat 4 MMA tournament. The incident happened in first round when McCain hit Perry's face with a knee. Blake wanted to continue the fight but wasn't allowed. "I'm healing up quick," Blake wrote on Instagram sharing videos.

1.title: Pics of rare 'ring galaxy' taken by world's most powerful telescope released
1.article_body: The pictures of a rare 'ring galaxy' called Cartwheel Galaxy taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, have been released by NASA. NASA tweeted, "Believe it or not...this galaxy was probably your average spiral galaxy before it collided with a smaller galaxy over 400 million years ago. Now, it's made up of 2 rings."

2.title: Giant 650-foot-deep sinkhole opens up in Chile, picture emerges
2.article_body: Chilean authorities on Monday said they are investigating a giant 'mysterious' sinkhole which opened up near the capital city Santiago. The sinkhole is about 25 meters (82 feet) in diameter and is approximately 200 metres (656 feet) deep, an official said. "We haven't detected any material down there, but we've seen the presence of a lot of water," he added.

3.title: India's trade deficit hits record high of $31 billion in July
3.article_body: India's merchandise trade deficit jumped to a new record high of $31.02 billion in July, Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said on Tuesday. The previous record high was set in June 2022, when trade deficit was $26.18 billion. As per provisional data released by the Commerce Ministry, merchandise imports stood at $66.26 billion while exports stood at $35.24 billion in July.

4.title: 115 arrested for illegal mining in Rajasthan
4.article_body: In a drive against illegal mining, Rajasthan Police arrested 115 people and impounded 278 vehicles from July 22 to 31, an official said on Tuesday. Additional Director General of Police Hawa Singh Ghumaria said 12,616 tonnes of illegally mined stone, gravel and sand were seized. In total, 191 cases have been registered across the state.

5.title: Will launch military action to counter this: China as Pelosi lands in Taiwan
5.article_body: China on Tuesday called US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit "extremely dangerous" and said it will "launch a series of targeted military operations to counter this". Chinese military spokesperson said that the forces have been put on "high alert". This came after Pelosi landed in Taipei and expressed "solidarity" with Taiwan, despite repeated warnings from China.

6.title: 38-year-old drunk man trying to swim across Chambal river drowns
6.article_body: A 38-year-old man drowned on Monday while trying to cross the Chambal river. He was not able to swim due to his drunken state, a report said. The man has been identified as Chagganlal Prajapat, a resident of Hatnara village, Madhya Pradesh. Prajapat was reportedly accompanying Alot's newly-elected sarpanch who had visited Goddess Joganiya temple for the purpose of blessings.

7.title: Al-Zawahiri's death shows we can root out terror without war: Obama
7.article_body: Reacting to Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri's death by US drone strike in Afghanistan, ex-US President Barack Obama said that the incident highlighted that it's possible to root out terrorism without being at war. "I hope it provides a small measure of peace to...9/11 families," he added. Zawahiri became Al-Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

8.title: Uber likely to sell its 7.8% stake in Zomato tomorrow: Report
8.article_body: Uber is likely to sell a 7.8% stake in food delivery firm Zomato through a $373 million block deal on Wednesday, Reuters reported. The offer size of 612 million shares is based on the lower end of a ₹48-54 price range set for the deal. Thus, the deal would be concluded at a 2.8%-13.6% discount to the share's latest close.

9.title: Indian women's hockey team lose to England 1-3 in group match at CWG 2022
9.article_body: Indian women's hockey team lost to England 1-3 in their third Pool A match at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Tuesday. Vandana Katariya scored India's only goal in the fourth quarter. India are currently placed third in the group, with six points from three matches. India will face Canada in their fourth match on Wednesday.

10.title: People should focus on bigger issues: Payal on Ranveer's nude pics controversy
10.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi, while reacting to the controversy surrounding Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot, said that people have made a big issue of his photoshoot which was unnecessary. She added that people should focus on bigger issues like rapes and murders. "It's really sad that they are talking about the photos and neglecting the main issues," Payal further said.

11.title: Somalia appoints former deputy leader of al-Shabaab as govt minister
11.article_body: Somalia's Prime Minister Hamza Abdi Barre on Tuesday named Mukhtar Robow, former deputy leader of al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab terrorist group, as the Minister for Religious Affairs. Robow had split from the group in 2013 and publicly denounced the group when he came to the government side in 2017. Al-Shabaab fighters have killed tens of thousands of people in Somalia.

12.title: Learned Hindi just to understand Amitabh Bachchan's dialogues: Sudeep
12.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep has said that he was a huge fan of Amitabh Bachchan in his youth, adding that he learned Hindi just to understand his dialogues and Kishore Kumar's songs. "It wouldn't be wrong to say that people in the South have learned Hindi largely because of Kishore Kumar's songs and Amit ji's (Amitabh Bachchan) films," he added.

13.title: Congratulations for doing the unprecedented: Prez Murmu on lawn bowls CWG gold
13.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu congratulated Indian women's fours team of Lovely Choubey, Rupa Rani Tirkey, Pinki and Nayanmoni Saikia following their gold medal win in lawn bowls at CWG 2022. "Your resolve in the see-saw battle for victory in the finals made the country proud and inspired every Indian," she tweeted. It is India's first-ever gold in lawn bowls at CWG.

14.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against West Indies
14.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against West Indies in the third T20I. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Deepak Hooda replacing Ravindra Jadeja. Rohit said at the toss that Jadeja is being rested for the match. Both the teams have won one match each in the five-match series.

15.title: BSF troops fire at flying object along International Border in J&K
15.article_body: BSF troops on Monday opened fire at a flying object with a blinking light along the International Border (IB) in J&K's Kanachak sector, an official informed. The unidentified object was spotted while trying to intrude into the Indian territory from across the border, he said. The blinking light was not observed after the object was fired upon, he added.

16.title: US solidarity with Taiwan more important than ever today: Pelosi on reaching Taipei
16.article_body: After reaching Taiwan's Taipei amid heightened tensions with China, US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the visit "honours America's unwavering commitment to supporting Taiwan's vibrant democracy". She said, "America's solidarity with the 23 million people of Taiwan is more important today than ever." World is facing a "choice between autocracy and democracy", she added.

17.title: AAP announces 1st list of 10 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
17.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday released its first list of 10 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party said the candidates include members of tribal, backward and scheduled caste communities. Gujarat AAP Vice Presidents Bhemabhai Chaudhary, Jagmal Vala, Arjun Rathva and Sagar Rabari have been nominated from Deodar, Somnath, Chhotaudepur and Becharaji seats respectively.

18.title: Venus loses in 1st round at Citi Open in her 1st singles match after a year
18.article_body: Former world number one tennis player, Venus Williams, made a first-round exit at the WTA 250 Citi Open in Washington, DC. Notably, this was Williams' first singles match since August 2021. "Just a little rusty... I wish I could have pulled this match through for the crowd... But [it] doesn't always work out," the 42-year-old player said.

19.title: Rename nilgai as 'Jangli Ghoda': LS member urges Govt
19.article_body: A Samajwadi Party member on Tuesday urged the government in Lok Sabha to rename nilgai as 'Jangli Ghoda' (wild horse). Hindu sentiment is attached to monkeys, who are destroying sugarcane crops in parts of western UP, said ST Hasan. There should be an order to capture wild pigs and nilgai for saving crops, he added.

20.title: 22-year-old man booked for alleged rape of classmate in Jaipur
20.article_body: A 22-year-old man in Jaipur has been booked under IPC Section 376 after a complaint accusing him of rape was lodged by his classmate, police informed. The 20-year-old complainant was allegedly raped by the accused who gave her an intoxicating drink in the city's Jagatpura area, police added. The incident took place on Monday evening, police said citing the complaint.

21.title: Vikas Thakur lifts 346 kg to bag silver, India's 8th weightlifting medal at CWG 2022
21.article_body: Indian weightlifter Vikas Thakur bagged a silver medal in the men's 96-kg final at CWG 2022 after lifting a total of 346 kg. The 28-year-old lifted 155 kg in snatch and 191 kg in clean and jerk. India have now won as many as eight medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022, including three gold, three silver and two bronze medals.

22.title: US is directly involved in the conflict in Ukraine: Russia
22.article_body: The US is directly involved in the conflict in Ukraine because American spies have been approving and coordinating Ukrainian missile strikes on Russian forces, Russia said on Tuesday. The US has provided military aid to Ukraine. Russia's invasion of Ukraine has triggered the most serious crisis in relations between Russia and the West since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.

23.title: Chinese fighter jets cross Taiwan Strait amid Nancy Pelosi's visit: Reports
23.article_body: Chinese fighter jets have crossed the Taiwan Strait, local media reported on Tuesday, amid tensions over US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "China's Su-35 fighter jets are crossing the Taiwan Straits," reported state media. China had warned that US will "bear the responsibility and pay the price" if Pelosi visits Taiwan.

24.title: Russian Supreme Court labels Ukraine's Azov Regiment 'terror' group
24.article_body: Amid ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, Russian Supreme Court on Tuesday designated Ukraine's Azov Regiment as a terrorist group. This paves the way for captured soldiers to be tried under anti-terror laws and be jailed for up to 20 years. The Azov Regiment, which began as a paramilitary unit to combat pro-Russian rebels in 2014, was later integrated into Ukrainian national guard.

25.title: Student dies, 36 ill post drinking contaminated water in Chhattisgarh
25.article_body: A 19-year-old student died, while 36 others fell ill in the past three days, after allegedly consuming contaminated water at a nursing college in Chhattisgarh's Durg district, officials said on Tuesday. "The water purifier and coolers were not functioning properly and the students were drinking water from them," a senior official said.

26.title: UP govt dismisses 841 lawyers appointed in Allahabad High Court
26.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh has issued termination notices for 841 government lawyers appointed in the Allahabad High Court with immediate effect. The order was issued by Nikunj Mittal, Special Secretary, Law and Justice Department. Additional Advocate General Vinod Kant was also dismissed and the government letter provided no reason for the termination.

27.title: 75-year-old priest found dead on temple premises in Rajasthan
27.article_body: A 75-year-old priest was found dead on the premises of a temple in Rajasthan's Dholpur district, police said on Tuesday. Harinath Giri was found hanging from a tree, said Superintendent of Police, Dholpur, Dharmendra Singh. Giri, who stayed on the temple premises in Chandpur village, belonged to Uttar Pradesh, he said.

28.title: Census 2021, related activities postponed due to COVID-19: Centre
28.article_body: Union Minister Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said Census 2021 and related field activities have been postponed indefinitely due to the outbreak of COVID-19 in March 2020. The minister added that there were no plans to add the census to the concurrent list, enabling states to conduct it. The concurrent list comprises subjects of the Union and the states' interests.

29.title: India win men's TT team gold medal for 2nd straight time at CWG
29.article_body: India defeated Singapore 3-1 to clinch gold in the men's table tennis team event at CWG 2022. This is India's second consecutive gold medal in men's table tennis team event at CWG. With this, India joined England to bag second-most table tennis gold medals (seven) at CWG. India have now won 12 medals at CWG 2022, including five gold medals.

30.title: A historic gold: Anurag Thakur on India's 1st-ever gold in lawn bowls at CWG
30.article_body: Following India's first-ever gold medal in lawn bowls at Commonwealth Games on Tuesday, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "A historic gold for India." He added, "Absolutely ecstatic that our women's fours team - Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey has fetched the nation its first ever lawn bowls medal defeating South Africa 17-10 in the final!"

31.title: PM announces ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh for pilgrims electrocuted in WB accident
31.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of 10 pilgrims who died after a pickup van got electrocuted in West Bengal's Cooch Behar. He announced ₹50,000 compensation for those injured. The accident may have taken place due to a fault in the wiring of the generator of the DJ system in the van.

32.title: Kartik is the biggest star that we've today in the industry: Masaba
32.article_body: Actress-fashion designer Masaba Gupta has said that actor Kartik Aaryan is the "biggest star that we have today in the industry". Kartik recently made a cameo appearance in her web show 'Masaba Masaba season 2'. "Kartik was so nice and very spontaneous. He was great; it was great energy to have on set," Masaba further said.

33.title: UP govt sanctions ₹797 cr for roadworks near Ram temple in Ayodhya
33.article_body: During a state Cabinet meeting, the Uttar Pradesh government sanctioned ₹797.69 crore for broadening and renovating the roads leading to the Ram temple in Ayodhya. UP Tourism Minister Jaiveer Singh said the 12.940 km road from Saadatganj to Nayaghat on lines of Kashi Vishwanath Corridor, and the road from Faizabad to the Hanuman Garhi and Ram temples will be broadened.

34.title: Chennai's 2nd airport to cost ₹20,000 cr, handle 10 cr people: TN CM
34.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Tuesday that Chennai's second airport at Parandur will cost ₹20,000 crore and have the capacity to handle around 10 crore passengers annually. He added that the airport will be equipped with requisite facilities including two runways, terminal buildings and taxiways. He cited need for a new airport due to surge in passenger traffic.

35.title: Would've been happier if it hit him: Woman who threw shoe at Partha
35.article_body: A woman hurled a shoe at former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, who is an accused in the West Bengal School Service Commission scam, while he was being taken to the ED office on Tuesday. "I would have been happier if the shoe would have hit him on his head," she said when asked why she committed the act.

36.title: US House Speaker Pelosi lands in Taiwan despite Chinese warnings
36.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi reached Taiwan's Taipei on Tuesday, even as repeated warnings by China against the visit raised tensions between US and China. The top US official was reported to have been travelling in an Air Force aircraft which took off from Malaysia's Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday, although there was no official confirmation of the same.

37.title: Gyanvapi case lawyer Abhay Yadav passes away due to heart attack
37.article_body: Senior advocate Abhay Nath Yadav, who was representing the Anjuman Intezamia Masjid (AIM) committee in the Gyanvapi mosque case, died due to a heart attack on Sunday late night. Yadav was rushed to Trimurti Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, where doctors declared him dead upon arrival.

38.title: Vijay meets Salman, Chiranjeevi; says 'Your love for Liger means the world'
38.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda on Monday shared a post on Instagram thanking actors Chiranjeevi and Salman Khan for showering their blessings and love on his upcoming film 'Liger'. He also shared a picture wherein he could be seen standing next to Salman and Chiranjeevi. "Your blessings and love for #Liger mean the world to us! My respect and love always," Vijay wrote.

39.title: Our govt doing 'good work', cabinet expansion soon: Maha CM Shinde
39.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said that his government is doing "good work" and assured that a cabinet expansion will take place soon. Speaking in Pune, Shinde said, "We have reduced VAT on petrol [and] diesel, provided relief to the farmers by resuming the scheme providing an assistance of ₹50,000, reduced power tariff for lift irrigation and others."

40.title: Traffic suspended on J&K's Mughal Road after landslide
40.article_body: Vehicular movement was suspended on J&K's Mughal Road on Tuesday after heavy rains and a landslide was reported in the Poonch district. Several hundred vehicles were stranded on the historic road as clearance operations were underway. The Mughal Road, which connects Poonch and Rajouri districts in Jammu with southern Kashmir, is an alternative to the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway.

41.title: 2 minor girls killed after house collapses in K'taka's Dakshina Kannada
41.article_body: Two minor girls were killed after their house collapsed on Monday following a landslide in the Parvathamukhi village in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district. "The bodies of two minor girls were recovered by National Disaster Mitigation Fund (NDMF) and State Disaster Mitigation Fund (SDMF) personnel," SP Rishikesh Sonawane said. Landslides in the district in early July had claimed three lives.

42.title: Corbevax recommended as booster for adults vaccinated with Covishield, Covaxin: Reports
42.article_body: A government panel has reportedly recommended allowing Corbevax as a precaution dose for adults fully vaccinated with either Covishield or Covaxin. Corbevax, which is India's first indigenously developed RBD protein subunit vaccine, is currently being used to vaccinate children between 12 and 14 years of age. At present, the booster dose is same as the one used for primary vaccination.

43.title: Preparations underway for manufacturing monkeypox vaccine: Poonawalla
43.article_body: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla on Tuesday said all preparations are underway for manufacturing a monkeypox vaccine. "I briefed [Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya] on this. We're researching on the monkeypox vaccine and if there's a need for it," Poonawalla added. Currently, the only licensed monkeypox vaccine is the one manufactured for smallpox by a Danish firm.

44.title: Uber turns its cash flow positive for the first time in Apr-Jun quarter
44.article_body: Uber has recorded positive quarterly cash flow for the first time ever in the April-June 2022 quarter, generating free cash flow of $382 million as trips exceeded pre-pandemic levels. The number of drivers and delivery agents on its platform also rose to an all-time high of almost five million. Uber's net loss in the quarter stood at $2.6 billion.

45.title: Child infected with Ebola-like Marburg virus passes away in Ghana
45.article_body: A World Health Organization (WHO) official on Tuesday said that a child who contracted the highly infectious Ebola-like Marburg virus in Ghana has died. The death brings the total number of fatalities in Ghana to three since the country registered its first ever outbreak of Marburg in July. Notably, three cases of Marburg have been detected in Ghana so far.

46.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's PTI received illegal foreign funds: Poll body
46.article_body: The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) unanimously said on Tuesday that ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) received illegal funding from 34 foreign individuals and businesses. The ECP in its verdict said that the party "willfully" received prohibited funding from countries including UAE, US, Canada and Australia. ECP launched a probe into PTI's funding sources in 2014.

47.title: I-T dept finds over ₹1,000 cr black income of Gujarat-based group
47.article_body: The Central Board of Direct Taxes on Tuesday said it found "unaccounted" income of over ₹1,000 crore in raids conducted on a Gujarat-based business conglomerate last month. Without naming the group, the CBDT said it has businesses in chemicals, textiles, real estate, packaging and education. The raids were conducted in Ahmedabad, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Kolkata.

48.title: Indian swimmers Page, Rawat enter men's 1500m freestyle final at CWG 2022
48.article_body: Indian swimmers Advait Page and Kushagra Rawat qualified for the men's 1500 metres freestyle final after finishing fourth in their respective heats at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham on Tuesday. Page clocked 15:39.25 in the heat one, while Rawat had a timing of 15:47.77 in the heat two. The final will be held on Wednesday.

49.title: Govt acting upon political hatred & revenge: Congress on ED raids
49.article_body: The Congress party on Tuesday criticised the Centre over the Enforcement Directorate (ED) raids in around 14 locations in connection with the National Herald case. "This is the first time in independent India that the government is acting upon political hatred and revenge," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said. This is absolute rock bottom for Indian politics, she added.

50.title: Bill to make rail university autonomous introduced in Parliament
50.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan introduced the Central Universities (Amendment) Bill in Lok Sabha, which seeks to designate the National Rail and Transportation University as an autonomous central university. The bill intends to expand the university's scope to encompass the entire transport sector. "The proposed University will...go a long way in making the nation self-reliant," he said.

51.title: Govt polishing king's image as India battles unemployment: Rahul
51.article_body: India is battling an "epidemic of unemployment", but the government is spending billions just to polish the image of an "arrogant king", Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said on Tuesday. "We have to fight with every decree of the dictator, every attempt to suppress the voice of the people," Rahul said. Don't consider yourself alone, Congress is your voice, Gandhi added.

52.title: EV startup River raises $11 mn in Series A funding round
52.article_body: Electric vehicle startup River has raised $11 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Chris Sacca's Lowercarbon Capital, and saw participation from Toyota Ventures. The company, founded in 2020 by Aravind and Vipin George, plans to launch its first product by 2022 end or early 2023. The product is entirely built and designed in India.

53.title: World's most-tracked plane right now is US jet that may be carrying Pelosi to Taiwan
53.article_body: The most-tracked aircraft in the world right now is a US Air Force jet that took off from Kuala Lumpur, as internet users seek to track US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on a possible trip to Taiwan. Almost 3,00,000 users are following every move of SPAR19, according to FlightRadar24. There is no official confirmation that Pelosi is on the plane.

54.title: ICC invited to make case for cricket's inclusion in 2028 Olympics: Reports
54.article_body: Cricket's apex body, ICC, has been invited to make a presentation advocating the inclusion of cricket in the 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles. Cricket will reportedly be competing for an Olympic spot with eight other disciplines, including lacrosse and baseball. "We are assisting the LA28 organisers and providing them with the information for their assessment," ICC chief Geoff Allardice said.

55.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad acquires test-prep platform Exampur
55.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has acquired test-preparation platform for government jobs Exampur for an undisclosed amount. This is upGrad's third acquisition in a month after acquiring Harappa Education for ₹300 crore and recruitment firm Wolves India for an undisclosed amount. Exampur has a user base of over 10 million students and offers over 200 test-prep courses for government jobs.

56.title: 63-yr-old man, his son die of electrocution in UP's Ghazipur
56.article_body: Police on Tuesday said a father-son duo died after they were electrocuted in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur district. The incident took place on Monday, when 63-year-old Satish Narayan Malviya, a farmer, was bringing down clothes from a wire when his son, 28-year-old Ankit Malviya rushed to help him, police said. They were declared dead when taken to a community health centre.

57.title: B2B SaaS startup WebEngage raises $20 mn in Series B funding round
57.article_body: WebEngage, a B2B software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup, has raised $20 million in its Series B funding round. The round, led by Singularity Growth Opportunities Fund and SWC Global, saw participation from existing investors India Quotient, Blume Ventures and IAN Fund, among others. The firm claims to have burned $6 million to reach an annual revenue run rate of $20 million.

58.title: US dentist found guilty of wife's murder during Zambia trip in 2016
58.article_body: A dentist in the US on Monday was found guilty of shooting his wife to death during the couple's trip to Zambia in 2016. Lawrence Rudolph will be handed over his sentence in February. The convict faces a maximum term of life in prison or the death penalty. Lawrence was also found guilty of cashing in his wife's insurance claims.

59.title: Kohli should play more to return to form instead of breaks: Manjrekar
59.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said that batter Virat Kohli shouldn't be rested but instead be played more in order to return to form. "My personal view is the more Kohli would've played...[it] would've been better for him and Bhuvneshwar Kumar clearly has said...[that] the best way to come out of the rut is by playing," Manjrekar said.

60.title: Mentally unstable youth seen scavenging garbage in Thane; rescued
60.article_body: A 23-year-old mentally disabled youth, who was seen scavenging garbage, was rescued and admitted to a mental health facility in Thane. The facility's dietitian said his condition is now at least 50% more stable than the day he was admitted. A photojournalist, who had worked with several newspapers in Mumbai, was the first to spot the man last week.

61.title: 3 pvt Delhi hospitals to reserve 10 beds each for monkeypox cases
61.article_body: The Delhi government has identified three private hospitals for isolating persons with suspected and confirmed monkeypox cases. MD City Hospital, Batra Hospital and Kailash Deepak Hospital will reserve five beds each for confirmed and five beds each for suspected cases. Delhi reported its third monkeypox case on Tuesday after a 31-year-old Nigerian tested positive.

62.title: Mizoram logs 337 new COVID-19 cases, highest since March 13
62.article_body: Mizoram on Tuesday reported 337 new COVID-19 cases, the highest spike in its daily caseload since March 13, an official informed. On Monday, the state had logged 62 cases of the infection. Mizoram's single-day positivity rate reached 26.98% on Tuesday from 19.25% on the previous day, news agency PTI reported. The state's active case count now stands at 1,197.

63.title: Decentraland announces world's first metaverse ATM
63.article_body: Decentraland has partnered with Transak payment gateway and Metaverse Architects to launch the world's first metaverse ATM. Through the ATM, users can purchase any cryptocurrency. "Just like an ATM in real life, we wanted to give users a more seamless journey while navigating Web3," the ATM's developers said. Details on how ATMs will operate will be available on August 3.

64.title: Repaired cracks on Shikohpur flyover on Delhi-Jaipur highway: NHAI
64.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) on Monday said it has repaired cracks that had appeared in a one foot by one-and-a-half feet area on the flyover at Shikohpur crossing on the Delhi-Jaipur highway. "The repaired area has been barricaded to strengthen it. We'll ascertain the reasons behind this damage and act accordingly," said NHAI Project Director Ajay Arya.

65.title: Protests in B'luru can be held only inside Freedom Park: K'taka HC
65.article_body: Protests in Bengaluru can only be held inside Freedom Park, the Karnataka High Court has directed the state government, adding that strict measures must be taken against those who organise protests anywhere else. A division bench was disposing of a suo motu PIL from last year, after the Mekedatu rally of Congress caused major traffic disruption through the city.

66.title: US will 'pay the price' if Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan, warns China
66.article_body: China has warned US that it will "pay the price" if House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan. "What I can tell you is, the US will definitely have to...pay the price for harming China's sovereignty and security interests," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Hua Chunying told a press briefing in Beijing. Pelosi is expected to visit Taiwan today, as per reports.

67.title: 4 Indians with high IELTS scores fail to speak English in US court, probe ordered
67.article_body: A probe was launched in Gujarat's Mehsana to unearth an alleged illegal racket of helping ineligible college aspirants get high International English Language Testing System (IELTS) scores. This comes as four youths from Gujarat, who were arrested near the US-Canada border, were unable to speak in English in a US court. They had scored 6.5 to 7 bands in IELTS.

68.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
68.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states for the next few days. Extremely heavy rainfall is very likely over parts of Kerala and Tamil Nadu until August 4. It is likely over parts of Karnataka until August 5. Goa and Odisha may witness very heavy rainfall in the upcoming days.

69.title: 'India Out' campaign in Maldives was based on false propaganda: MEA
69.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Tuesday said the 'India Out' campaign in Maldives was based on "misinformation and false propaganda", adding that it didn't reflect the views of Maldivians. The remarks come amid Maldivian President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's current visit to India. The campaign, which started in 2020, accused India of trying to build military presence in Maldives.

70.title: Indian sprinter Dutee Chand fails to qualify for 100m semis at CWG 2022
70.article_body: Indian sprinter Dutee Chand failed to qualify for the women's 100 metres semi-final at Commonwealth Games 2022 on Tuesday. She finished fourth after clocking 11.55 seconds in her heat. Michelle-Lee Ahye of Trinidad and Tobago won the heat in 11.14 seconds. The top three from each heat and the next three fastest qualifed for the semi-final.

71.title: Arshdeep's ability to bear pressure stands out the most: India bowling coach
71.article_body: Team India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey praised Arshdeep Singh, saying he has been watching the India pacer since IPL and his ability to bear pressure stands out the most. "He bowls the hard overs, two in...powerplay and then at...death," he added. Mhambrey further said Arshdeep showed this ability when he bowled the 17th over of second T20I against West Indies.

72.title: China bans several Taiwanese food imports ahead of Pelosi's trip
72.article_body: Ahead of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's proposed visit to Taiwan, China on Monday banned imports from several Taiwanese food brands. "I learned about the ban before I got off work," a business manager at one of the affected Taiwanese food producers told Reuters. China has warned the US of consequences if Pelosi visits Taiwan, which China lays claim to.

73.title: India win gold medal in lawn bowls for the first time in Commonwealth Games history
73.article_body: India on Tuesday won their first-ever gold medal in lawn bowls in the history of Commonwealth Games (CWG). India's Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey defeated the South African team 17-10 in the final of women's fours event to clinch the gold medal. India have now bagged four gold medals at CWG 2022 so far.

74.title: Former New Zealand cricketer Heath Davis comes out as gay
74.article_body: Ex-New Zealand pacer Heath Davis has come out as gay. The 50-year-old opened up about his sexuality in a new documentary series. He stated he started to discover himself during New Zealand's tour to England in 1994. He added he used to go to saunas and seedy places to get sex as he didn't want to be seen.

75.title: Really liked Raksha Bandhan's trailer, it's a film about a common man: Aamir
75.article_body: Aamir Khan has opened up about the box office clash between his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Raksha Bandhan'. "I hope both...do well," he said. Aamir further said he really liked the trailer of 'Raksha Bandhan', adding, "Here is a film that's relevant. It's a film of a common man who does have problems of economic issues."

76.title: Liquor sales in Gurugram up 33% as shops in Delhi remain shut: Officials
76.article_body: Sale of Indian Made Foreign Liquor and Imported Foreign Liquor has risen 33% in Gurugram as several liquor stores are shut or running without adequate stocks in Delhi, senior Excise Department officials said. Liquor demand has increased in last two days and shopkeepers have enhanced their orders across labels, officials added. Several liquor vends also stopped offering discounts from Monday.

77.title: Dark & shady things happened with me in 'Anupamaa': Paras Kalnawat
77.article_body: Paras Kalnawat, who was ousted from 'Anupamaa' for signing 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', in an interview said "dark and shady things" happened with him on the show. "My scenes were cut...I was put in...bad light; people started falsely gossiping about me that I'd threatened them...And if...senior is going to talk against you, makers are going to believe...senior only," Paras added.

78.title: Pune woman cheated of ₹1.67 lakh while trying to order ₹400 cake online
78.article_body: A woman in Pune was duped of ₹1.67 lakh while trying to place an order for a birthday cake worth ₹400 online. A fraudster posed as a bakery employee and tricked her into paying the huge amount. The victim had found the number of the shop after browsing the internet and placed the order there.

79.title: Man hiding $20,000 using papad packets, spice boxes caught at IGI Airport
79.article_body: A Bangkok-bound Indian man was apprehended at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport with $19,900 (₹15.5 lakh) on Tuesday. The man had concealed the foreign currency inside boxes marked as spices and between layers of papad packets, an officer said. He was intercepted during security checks. He could not furnish a valid authorisation for carrying the money, the officer added.

80.title: 4,800 held in 3 yrs for hurting religious feelings, promoting enmity: Govt
80.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs informed the Lok Sabha that 4,794 people were arrested in three years (2018, 2019 and 2020) for hurting religious sentiments and promoting enmity between groups on grounds of religion, race and place of birth. Uttar Pradesh saw the highest number of arrests (628) in such cases, followed by Tamil Nadu and Kerala, minister Nityanand Rai said.

81.title: 6 Pakistani soldiers killed in helicopter crash in Balochistan
81.article_body: Six Pakistani soldiers, including XII Corps Commander Sarfraz Ali, were killed after a helicopter carrying them crashed in Balochistan province, the military said on Tuesday. "Accident occurred due to bad weather as per initial investigations," the military added. The helicopter, which was helping with flood relief work, had lost contact with air traffic control on Monday.

82.title: 6 killed, including 2 girls aged 6 and 11, in landslides in Karnataka
82.article_body: Six persons were killed in Karnataka's Uttara Kannada and Dakshina Kannada districts due to landslides inflicted by heavy rains. In Uttara Kannada, four of a family were killed after a part of a hill collapsed on their house. Meanwhile, in Dakshina Kannada, the bodies of two sisters, Shruthi (11) and Jnanashree (6), were found holding their hands together, police said.

83.title: Suvendu Adhikari briefs Amit Shah on West Bengal SSC scam
83.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari met Home Minister Amit Shah in the Parliament today. He briefed him about the teachers recruitment scam and other issues. "I briefed him how Bengal is completely mired in corrupt activities such as the teachers recruitment scam. Also requested him to implement CAA at the earliest," Adhikari tweeted after the meet.

84.title: I-T Department raids premises of Tamil film producer Anbu Chezhiyan
84.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting raids at 40 locations linked to Tamil film producer GN Anbu Chezhiyan for alleged tax evasion. According to reports, raids started this morning at 6 am on 30 properties, including his home in Madurai and 10 locations in Chennai. He has been under the IT radar since February 2020, reports added.

85.title: Taking action against dubious digital loan apps: Sitharaman to RS
85.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed Rajya Sabha that the Centre is taking action against dubious digital loan apps. "Only a couple of months ago...in Telangana, a lot of people have been put to harassment and action has been initiated," Sitharaman said. She added that the government is also taking action against Indians who assist in establishing these companies.

86.title: Priyanka Chopra 'lost' her Miss World gown during travel, says the actress
86.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra revealed in a new interview that her strapless bejewelled gown that she wore when she was crowned Miss World 2000, was lost "in her many travels". The actress told People magazine that 'she wished she had kept' the gown. "I was always a nomad. I moved around so much, especially in the last 15 years," she added.

87.title: Mumbai woman missing for 20 years found in Pak using social media
87.article_body: A 70-year-old woman from Mumbai, who went missing 20 years ago after emigrating for work, has been traced to Pakistan with the help of social media. As per reports, the woman recently connected with her family in Kurla after moving out of Mumbai in 2002, when she was allegedly cheated by an agent with the promise of employment in Dubai.

88.title: Sambit Patra criticises Opposition for backing Sanjay Raut
88.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Opposition leaders for supporting Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in an alleged land scam case. “Entire India is seeing the manner in which the Opposition is doing politics over corruption," said Patra. The Shiv Sena MP has been sent to ED custody till August 4.

89.title: Edtech startup OckyPocky raises funds from Silicon Valley-based ventures
89.article_body: OckyPocky, an interactive English learning application, has secured an undisclosed amount in seed funding from Silicon Valley-based Goodwater Capital and AngelList Quant Fund, company's founder Amit Agrawal said. The startup, founded in 2017, aims to use funds to grow content for a wider vernacular audience. Udaan Co-founder Sujeet Kumar and SucSEED Indovation Fund are also among its investors.

90.title: Hyderabad receives heavy rains; roads waterlogged & traffic affected
90.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Hyderabad on Tuesday, causing waterlogging and affecting traffic. The traffic movement was disrupted in areas like Khairatabad, Punjagutta, Banjara Hills, Jubilee Hills, Secunderabad, Mehdipatnam, Ameerpet and LB Nagar. The traffic police asked the people to not immediately start their journey after the stoppage of rain and wait for one to two hours.

91.title: New traffic sign spotted on Bengaluru road, traffic police explain its meaning
91.article_body: A man spotted an unusual road sign in Bengaluru and shared a picture on Twitter requesting traffic police to explain its usage. Whitefield traffic police responded, "That is a cautionary sign board which tells about a possible blind person likely on the road. Exercise caution while driving. There is a blind school at Hopefarm junction where this board is placed."

92.title: Monkeypox not a new disease, no need to fear it: Mandaviya
92.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said that monkeypox is not a new disease and asserted that India was taking a step-by-step approach to deal with it. "Before the first case in Kerala, we had issued guidelines to all the states," he said. There's no need to fear the virus, Mandaviya added.

93.title: Hardik Pandya is two players in one and is a luxury: McGrath
93.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya, Glenn McGrath said the India all-rounder is two players in one and is a luxury to have. "Hardik is very much a confident player. If he's bowling well, it has a positive impact on his batting...he is a good, intelligent bowler and powerful hitter," he added. Hardik is currently playing in five-match T20I series against West Indies.

94.title: Guj youths with high IELTS score fail to speak in English in US court
94.article_body: A probe was launched in Gujarat's Mehsana district to unearth an illegal racket of helping ineligible college aspirants acquire high International English Language Testing System (IELTS) scores. This comes as four youths from Gujarat, who were arrested near the US-Canada border, were unable to converse in English in a US court. They had scored 6.5 to 7 bands in IELTS.

95.title: Pic shows giant hybrid fish caught by fisherman in US, people comment 'What a monster'
95.article_body: A US fisherman recently caught an enormous tiger muskie in Connecticut's Lake Lillinonah. Taking to Facebook, the Connecticut Fish and Wildlife shared its image and wrote, "The tiger muskie is a cross between a northern pike and a muskellunge." Reacting to it, a person wrote, "I don't want to swim anywhere anymore," while another comment read, "What a monster!"

96.title: Wimbledon winner Elena loses in 1st round in San Jose; blames packed schedule
96.article_body: Wimbledon 2022 women's singles champion Elena Rybakina made a first-round exit from the Silicon Valley Classic in San Jose on Monday. This was the 23-year-old tennis player's first match after winning the Wimbledon final. "It was a tough week after Wimbledon... I had a lot of travelling. I didn't have enough time to prepare for the hard season," Rybakina said.

97.title: Over 10 mn people crossed border from Ukraine since war began: UN
97.article_body: More than 10 million people have crossed the border from Ukraine since the war began, the UN Refugee Agency said on Tuesday. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. As per the Ukrainian Foreign Ministry, the country's forces have killed about 41,170 Russian soldiers and destroyed 1,768 Russian tanks and more than 410 aircraft, including 191 helicopters, so far.

98.title: 32-year-old woman attacked over ₹200 at Kalyan station, 2 arrested
98.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was injured after she was allegedly attacked with a sharp blade by two men at Kalyan railway station after she refused to give them ₹200. The accused were identified as Khwaja Shaikh and Rahim Shaikh, both 30 years old. "The CCTV had captured the entire incident based on which we arrested the two," a police official said.

99.title: Incorrect: Jackky on report saying Akshay & Tiger reduce fees for 'Bade...'
99.article_body: Producer Jackky Bhagnani has reacted to a report claiming that Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff have reduced their acting fees for 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan', following the failure of their last films at the box office. The report also claimed that the film was put on hold due to budgeting issues. Reacting to claims, Jackky tweeted, "Absolutely Incorrect!!"

100.title: Guj woman's hands transplanted in TN man, he promises her mother to take care of tattoos
100.article_body: The hands of a 26-year-old brain dead woman from Ahmedabad were successfully transplanted in a 24-year-old man from Tamil Nadu who lost both his hands due to electrical burns in 2018. The man said the woman's mother broke down seeing the tattoos on her daughter's hands and he promised to take care of them for the rest of his life.

101.title: I'm not convinced it'll last: Lopez's 1st husband on her marriage with Affleck
101.article_body: Ojani Noa, first husband of Jennifer Lopez, spoke about her fourth marriage with Ben Affleck and said he's not convinced that their marriage will last. According to him, Lopez will be married "seven or eight times". "I can't see her...settling down with one person...She pushes herself to constantly go forward in...professional life...but she also moves on in...private life," Ojani added.

102.title: CAA to be implemented after COVID vaccine drive: Shah to Bengal BJP
102.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday assured the West Bengal unit of the BJP that the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) will be implemented once the precaution vaccine dose drive for COVID-19 is completed. Shah said this to West Bengal Leader of Opposition and BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari when the latter said that the situation in the state was 'critical'.

103.title: Man jumps from 1st floor of court building to escape police, injured
103.article_body: An undertrial, Raju Kumar, sustained injuries after he jumped from the first floor of a court building in Gurugram on Monday in a bid to escape police custody, officials said. Kumar is being treated at the civil hospital for his injuries. A fresh FIR has been registered against him for trying to flee, the officials added.

104.title: Advocate dragged out of car, stabbed to death in T'gana's Mulugu
104.article_body: An advocate, Malla Reddy, was waylaid, dragged out of his car and stabbed to death on Monday evening in Telangana's Mulugu district. Malla Reddy's driver told the police that the assailants were wearing clinical masks and dragged the lawyer to the bushes by the roadside. "We...know that there are 10 cases, mostly land disputes, registered against Reddy," police said.

105.title: 15 suspected patients test negative for Monkeypox in Maharashtra
105.article_body: At least 15 samples of suspected monkeypox infection have tested negative for the disease in Maharashtra, a senior health official said on Monday. "So far, not a single positive case has been found in the state," Dr Pradeep Awate, the state's surveillance officer, said. The samples were sent to the National Institute of Virology (NIV) in Pune.

106.title: Baha'i individuals arrested for links with Israel, says Iran
106.article_body: Iran on Monday said it had arrested multiple followers of the banned Baha'i faith for links to a centre in Israel, state media reported. The individuals have also been accused of proselytising, reports said. Notably, the Baha'i International Community, whose governing council operates from Israel, had informed about the arrests of "a significant number of Baha'is" in Iran.

107.title: 2 dead, 4 critically ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
107.article_body: At least two persons died and four others fell critically ill after they allegedly consumed suspected spurious liquor in Bihar's Saran, as per reports. The victims had reportedly gone for a liquor party after finishing their work on Monday evening. "When my husband returned at night, he started vomiting," the wife of one of the victims said.

108.title: PM's brother stages dharna in Delhi with fair price shop dealers' demands
108.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's brother Prahlad Modi on Tuesday staged a dharna in Delhi with various demands raised by the All India Fair Price Shop Dealers' Federation. Prahlad Modi, who is the vice president of the organisation, was joined by other members. Among other demands, they are demanding that the 'West Bengal Ration Model' of free distribution be implemented across India.

109.title: WB Ministers don't pick calls even if we ring 10 times: Minister
109.article_body: Union Minister Pratima Bhoumik, while replying to queries on the implementation of a Central government scheme in West Bengal, said that Ministers in the state don't pick up calls even when called 10 times. Bhoumik said that she has been trying to distribute appliances worth ₹12 crore to differentially-abled and senior citizens in the district but has been unsuccessful.

110.title: Avendus Future Leaders Fund buys stake for ₹195 cr in Xpressbees
110.article_body: Avendus Future Leaders Fund has bought a minority stake in logistics firm Xpressbees for ₹195 crore from Elevation Capital, the company said in a statement. This is the sixth investment from  Avendus Future Leaders Fund II that has assets under management of as much as ₹1,500 crore. In February, Xpressbees raised $300 million in a funding round.

111.title: 3 held for cheating people in Gurugram: Police
111.article_body: Three members of a gang that cheated people by assuring them home delivery of liquor were arrested, Gurugram Police said on Monday. The accused also cheated people on pretext of buying and selling vehicles online, a police official said. "It has been found that they have cheated people to the tune of ₹25 lakh in...last 15 days," the official added.

112.title: Who is 'Most Wanted' terrorist al-Adel, likely to be al-Qaeda's next chief?
112.article_body: FBI 'Most Wanted Terrorist' Saif al-Adel is likely to be the next chief of al-Qaeda after Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a US drone strike, the Middle East Institute reported. He's a former Egyptian Army officer and is wanted in the 1998 US embassy bombings which led to 250 deaths. The explosive expert was earlier affiliated with Egyptian Islamic Jihad.

113.title: Russia warns US over Pelosi's 'purely provocative' visit to Taiwan
113.article_body: Russia on Tuesday warned the US that an expected visit by US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taiwan would put the US on a collision course with China. Pelosi's possible visit is "purely provocative", Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov added. China has said its military won't "sit idly by" if Pelosi visits Taiwan, which Beijing considers its own territory.

114.title: I-T Dept reduces time for ITR verification to 30 days from 120 days
114.article_body: The Income Tax Department has reduced the time limit for e-verification or hard copy submission of the ITR-V. From August 1 onwards, the time limit for e-verification or submission of ITR-V will be 30 days instead of the earlier 120 days. E-verification of an ITR completes the return filing process, failing which, an ITR is treated as invalid.

115.title: Full schedule for Asia Cup cricket 2022 released, India to face Pakistan on August 28
115.article_body: The entire schedule for Asia Cup 2022 has been released. India and Pakistan have been placed in the same group. India will kick off their campaign with a match against Pakistan on August 28 in Dubai. Meanwhile, Sri Lanka will face Afghanistan in the tournament opener on August 27 in Dubai. The final will be held on September 11.

116.title: They have got a 'few challenges': Glenn McGrath on the future of ODIs
116.article_body: Former Australian pacer Glenn McGrath said he believes that ODI cricket will remain exciting as long as runs are being scored, adding that it will be interesting to see the future of ODIs. "They have got a few challenges," he stated. Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram had recently said that ODI cricket is dying and administrators should consider scrapping the format.

117.title: 6 Indian startups selected for South Korean accelerator programme
117.article_body: The K-Startup Grand Challenge 2022 is the world's largest accelerator programme for which six Indian startups have been selected. An initiative of the South Korean Ministry of SMEs and Startups and the National IT Industry Promotion Agency, the programme received over 2,600 applications from 122 countries. Through this initiative, the selected startups can expand their business into South Korea.

118.title: Was offered ₹25 cr to vote for one candidate in Rajya Sabha poll: Rajasthan minister
118.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Rajendra Gudha has alleged that he was offered ₹25 crore if he voted for a particular person in the recently held Rajya Sabha election. He said he asked his wife who told him that they would rather have goodwill. "When the political crisis [in Rajasthan] was going on, I had an offer of ₹60 crore," he added.

119.title: Shraddha to star opposite Kartik Aaryan in 'Tezaab' remake: Report
119.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor has reportedly been approached to star opposite Kartik Aaryan in the remake of 1988 film 'Tezaab'. "Shraddha and Kartik haven't shared onscreen space together so far and if things work out, this is a pair [makers] would like to bet on," India Today quoted a source as saying. The original film starred Madhuri Dixit and Anil Kapoor.

120.title: Pitch was playing nicely, we didn't apply ourselves: Rohit on 2nd T20I loss
120.article_body: After India's five-wicket loss against West Indies in second T20I, India skipper Rohit Sharma said his side didn't bat well in Basseterre. "The pitch was playing nicely but we didn't apply ourselves. But this can happen. When you're doing something as a batting group, you might not always succeed," he added. India were bowled out for 138 in 19.4 overs.

121.title: J'khand schools not notified as Urdu schools told to remove 'Urdu' from name
121.article_body: Jharkhand government's primary education department has issued an order asking schools which have not been notified as Urdu schools to remove 'Urdu' word from their names. The order stated that such un-notified schools should also have a weekly off on Sunday. Moreover, the order also said that morning prayers in these un-notified schools will be kept like in the past.

122.title: Tabu cried thinking I am 'really dead': JD on his death scene in Satya
122.article_body: Discussing a scene depicting his character's death in 'Satya', actor JD Chakravarthy said he was asked not to show the film to his mother as the scene is very real and no mother can see her son dying. JD added that director Ram Gopal Varma told him actress Tabu started crying after watching the film, thinking he was "really dead".

123.title: E-commerce platform Combonation raises $2 mn in pre-seed funding
123.article_body: E-commerce platform Combonation secured a pre-seed funding of $2 million in the latest funding round from undisclosed private investors. The company aims to use funds to expand in technology and manpower. Combonation is looking to open over 50 offline retail stores across Delhi-NCR and has established a plan to expand to more than 100 locations in North India.

124.title: BMC to start door-to-door screening for cancer & diabetes in Mumbai
124.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to start door-to-door screening and hospital examinations for cancer and diabetes from August 15. "Although we are starting with hypertension, the goal is to test Mumbaikars for...diabetes, common malignancies and mental health issues," a BMC officer said. "The scaling up of the programme will take time," she added.

125.title: Private entities can use drones for delivery purposes: Govt
125.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha that government would have no objection if private players use drones for delivery purposes. The response mentioned that the government used drones to deliver vaccines to remote regions during the pandemic. More than 100 Industrial Training Institutes will be opened to teach five courses in drone technology.

126.title: 4 BJP MLAs suspended from Jharkhand Assembly for 'unruly' behaviour
126.article_body: Jharkhand Assembly Speaker Rabindra Nath Mahato on Tuesday suspended four BJP MLAs from the House till August 4. Bhanu Pratap Shahi, Dhullu Mahto, Jai Prakash Bhai Patel and Randhir Singh were suspended for alleged unruly behaviour. This came after a commotion was created in the House as BJP members sought CM Hemant Soren's resignation and demanded a debate on corruption.

127.title: Delhi govt to start 'Doctor on Wheels' scheme for construction workers
127.article_body: Delhi government on Monday announced 'Doctor on Wheels' scheme for construction workers under which they will be offered routine health check-ups. As per the official statement, the government will also launch unique 'mobile creches' for children of these workers at sites, where they will get better day-care facilities. The Delhi government is running 17 welfare schemes for construction workers.

128.title: Reserve Bank of Australia hikes rate to 6-year high of 1.85%
128.article_body: In a first, the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) on Tuesday hiked its benchmark interest rate for four months in a row by 0.5% points to a six-year high of 1.85%. RBA Governor Philip Lowe said the increase in interest rates was because of the "high priority" to return inflation to the 2-3% range over time.

129.title: Priyanka Chopra breaks down as she meets Ukrainian refugees, shares video
129.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, who is on a visit to Poland to meet Ukrainian refugees, shared a video of her interaction with the women and children, who were forced to leave their homes. One clip shows the children giving her handmade dolls and another clip shows her breaking down on hearing the refugees' stories. Priyanka is a global goodwill ambassador with UNICEF.

130.title: Weightlifter Punam Yadav misses out on CWG medal after 3 failed clean & jerk attempts
130.article_body: Indian weightlifter Punam Yadav missed out on a medal at CWG 2022 after three failed clean and jerk attempts during her women's 76-kg event. Punam, who bagged gold medal at CWG 2018 and a bronze medal at CWG 2014, had lifted 98 kg in snatch. She failed to successfully lift 116 kg in all of her clean and jerk attempts.

131.title: I fight mindsets: Kangana on Karan Johar's 'Hindi downmarket' remark
131.article_body: Reacting to filmmaker Karan Johar sharing in his biography that he considered Hindi as "downmarket", actress Kangana Ranaut wrote on Instagram, "I don't fight individuals, I fight mindsets." "To a large extent, I've fought this prejudice against small Hindi-speaking people," added Kangana. Karan Johar had shared in his biography that he didn't like producer Aditya Chopra as he spoke Hindi.

132.title: N Korean hackers faking resumes to get jobs at US crypto firms: Report
132.article_body: North Korean hackers are reportedly browsing job sites like LinkedIn and Indeed and stealing information from legitimate profiles to build plagiarised resumes to get jobs at US cryptocurrency firms. A report said that the hackers are securing employment at these companies in order to raise funds for the North Korean government.

133.title: 81 Chinese nationals given 'Leave India' notice during 2019-21: Govt
133.article_body: The Lok Sabha was informed on Tuesday that 81 Chinese nationals were given 'Leave India' notice while 117 others from that country were deported for violating visa conditions and other illegal acts during 2019 to 2021. As many as 726 Chinese nationals were placed in 'adverse list' for violating visa conditions and other illegal acts, Union Minister Nityanand Rai said.

134.title: Oommen Chandy becomes longest serving MLA in Kerala Assembly
134.article_body: Congress leader and ex-Kerala CM Oommen Chandy became the longest serving MLA in the state Assembly by completing 51 years and over three months. He broke the existing record in the name of former Kerala Congress (M) supremo late KM Mani. Chandy represented only Puthuppally in the past five decades. He became the MLA at the age of 27.

135.title: SC seeks govt's response on pleas over CBI, ED chiefs' tenure extension
135.article_body: SC on Tuesday sought the Centre's response on the petitions challenging the ordinances passed in November 2021 for the extension of the tenure of CBI & ED chiefs by up to five years. The petitions allege that amendments were brought to extend the tenure of ED director Sanjay Kumar Mishra. CJI NV Ramana is heading the bench hearing the pleas.

136.title: Govt to fill over 84,000 vacancies in armed forces by Dec 2023: MoS Rai
136.article_body: The central government has decided to fill up existing vacancies in the armed forces by December 2023, MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said on Tuesday. He informed that there were a total of 84,659 vacancies in the Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) and Assam Rifles till July 31, 2022. Of these, the maximum (27,510) were in CRPF, he added.

137.title: Monekypox isn't a new disease, don't panic: Union Health Minister
137.article_body: Amid a rise in monkeypox cases, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday advised people to not panic and said that the awareness programmes are being run in collaboration with state governments. "When cases started appearing in...world, India had already started preparations," he added. Furthermore, he said that monkeypox "isn't a new disease" in India and in the world.

138.title: Gold prices marginally down in India, hit 4-week high globally
138.article_body: Gold prices in India were trading marginally lower on Tuesday with gold October futures down by ₹96 at ₹51,530 per 10 gram at the Multi Commodity Exchange. Silver September futures fell ₹256 to ₹58,070 per kg. Meanwhile, gold hit a four-week high globally as a weaker dollar and a dip in US Treasury yields bolstered its demand.

139.title: 3-year-old twins joined at the brain separated using virtual reality in Brazil
139.article_body: A pair of twins who were conjoined at the head have been successfully separated with the help of virtual reality in Brazil. The three-year-old boys underwent seven surgeries, involving over 27 hours of operating time in the final operation alone, and almost 100 medical staff. They are now able to look at each other for the first time.

140.title: Manpreet Kaur qualifies for women's shot put final at CWG 2022
140.article_body: Manpreet Kaur has qualified for the women's shot put final at the Commonwealth Games 2022. Kaur qualified with a throw of 16.78m and was ranked seventh overall in the qualifying rounds. Jamaica's Danniel Thomas-Dodd topped the qualifying rounds with a throw of 18.42m. The automatic qualifying mark was 18m in the event.

141.title: BJP's eyes blindfolded with ego; can't see rising inflation: Rahul
141.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for rising inflation by sharing a chart of increases in prices of eight basic commodities. "BJP went on to claim in the Parliament that there is no inflation in India. Anyways, how will they see rising inflation? Their eyes are blindfolded with ego," Rahul tweeted.

142.title: PMC approves ₹6.24 crore for machine cleaning of public toilets
142.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved ₹6.24 crore for the cleaning of public and community toilets via jetting machines. "PMC used to clean public toilets manually. Following complaints over cleanliness, the civic body has decided to use jetting machines...Zonal officers will float tender, hire agency and handle the project," PMC's Solid Waste Management Department head Asha Raut said.

143.title: Actor Prabhas has weird purity in his eyes: Actress Kriti Sanon
143.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said she would "love" to work with her 'Adipurush' co-star Prabhas again. "He has some weird purity in his eyes...he is one of those people whose eyes are really expressive and very deep and there is something very pure," she added. Filmmaker Om Raut is the director of 'Adipurush'.

144.title: Anupam Kher joins cast of Ravi Teja-starrer 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'
144.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher announced on Monday that he has joined the cast of actor Ravi Teja's upcoming film 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'. "My 528th film is Telugu one with great talent in every department," Kher wrote on Instagram while sharing his look from the film. The film is based on a notorious thief and is set in Andhra Pradesh's Stuartpuram village.

145.title: 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening, will go on floors next year: Alia Bhatt
145.article_body: Alia Bhatt has said that 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening and will go on the floors next year. The film will also feature Priyanka Chopra and Katrina Kaif. "Of course, we cannot go on the floor this year. We ain't letting that film go. We are fighting for it and we are all too excited about it," the actress added.

146.title: US to send $550 million worth of new weapons to Ukraine
146.article_body: The US has announced an additional $550 million in military aid to Ukraine.  The new package will include more ammunition for the High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) and 75,000 rounds of 155mm artillery ammunition, US Defence Department said. "We remain committed to providing Ukraine with the capabilities they need to defend their homeland," US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said.

147.title: Woman throws slipper at Partha Chatterjee while being taken to ED office
147.article_body: A woman threw a slipper at former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee today while he was being taken to the ED office from central government-run hospital near Kolkata. "I had come to throw my slipper on him. He has taken money from poor people. I would have been happier if the slipper would have hit him on his head," she said.

148.title: UK PM candidate Truss to scrap plans to restrict junk food deals
148.article_body: Liz Truss, the leading contender to become UK's next PM, said she will scrap plans to restrict multi-buy deals on unhealthy foods. In an interview, Truss said Britons don't want the government telling them what to eat. In May, UK delayed plans to ban 'buy one get one free' offers on junk food due to cost-of-living crisis.

149.title: Mahua Moitra releases pics with '₹1.5 lakh bag' amid criticism she hid it in Parliament
149.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has shared photos showing her with her bag on different occasions in the Parliament complex. This comes after she was criticised for allegedly trying to hide the bag, which reports claimed was priced over ₹1.5 lakh, during a debate on inflation. She tweeted, "Jholewala fakir in Parliament since 2019. Jhola leke aye the...jhola leke chal padenge..."

150.title: Karan Johar knows cinema, understands dynamics of filmmaking minutely: Azmi
150.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi, speaking about her experience while filming for 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', has said that she was amazed at filmmaker Karan Johar's understanding of the craft. Karan is the director of the film. "Karan is a director who knows cinema and understands the dynamics and nuances of filmmaking minutely," she further added.

151.title: Bajaj Auto two-wheeler sales drop by 5% in July to 3.15 lakh units
151.article_body: Bajaj Auto on Monday reported a 5% fall in its total two-wheeler sales at 3,15,054 units in July 2022 as against 3,30,569 units in the corresponding period last year. While domestic two-wheeler sales rose by 5% to 1,64,384 units, exports fell by 14%. The commercial vehicle sales rose by 3% with 39,616 units sold against 38,547 units in July 2021.

152.title: Pelosi's Taiwan visit will undermine US-China relations: China
152.article_body: Chinese Ambassador to UN, Zhang Jun, has said that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit would undermine the relationship between China and the US. "Such a visit is apparently very much dangerous and provocative," Zhang said during a news conference. Zhang also urged Washington to honour the one-China principle. US said it will not be intimidated by China's warnings.

153.title: SpiceJet clears all pending dues with Airports Authority of India
153.article_body: SpiceJet entered into an agreement with the Airports Authority of India (AAI) and cleared all outstanding principal dues of the airport operator. In 2020, the AAI had put SpiceJet on a ‘cash and carry’ basis for the failure to clear its previous dues. Under this model, an airline has to make payments to the AAI for various charges every day.

154.title: Had to play dad to 20-year-old, I thought 'F*** you': Colin on 1st older role
154.article_body: Actor Colin Farrell said that he almost took offence when he was offered his first older role. "I do remember first time I got script where I was playing father of someone who was 20 and I thought, 'F*** you'. I realised it was an absolutely inappropriate offer to make," he said, adding that he's having fun in his 40s.

155.title: Nigerian national in Delhi tests positive for monkeypox, 3rd case in national capital
155.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported its third confirmed case of monkeypox. This comes after a 31-year-old man from Nigeria, admitted to the Lok Nayak Hospital, tested positive for the virus. "India currently has eight confirmed cases of monkeypox. Out of the eight patients, five have a history of foreign travel," Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said.

156.title: 6 Army jawans booked in Raj after man admitted by them to hospital dies
156.article_body: An FIR has been registered against six Army jawans in Rajasthan after a 24-year-old man whom they had admitted to a hospital in Pokhran died, police said. The man and his friend had gone to the prohibited firing range in Pokhran on a motorcycle. The man's family claimed that he was caught by the jawans who thrashed him badly.

157.title: Wanted younger actress for Kareena's role, would've been mistake: Aamir on 'Laal...'
157.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has stated that the team was originally looking for a younger actress for Kareena Kapoor's role in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "That was a mistake we were making," he added. Aamir said they were looking at a video of another actor and accidentally saw Kareena in it. "Since she wasn't 25, we didn't think of her," he said.

158.title: Any experimentation should be avoided: Rajkumar on Suryakumar opening
158.article_body: Reacting to batter Suryakumar Yadav opening the innings in the T20I series against West Indies, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "This is a huge experiment." "Any experimentation involving him should be avoided," added Rajkumar. Discussing the decision to send Suryakumar as an opener, ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth stated, "Please don't do that...Don't spoil the cricketer."

159.title: NMMT introduces buses for Bhiwandi from Navi Mumbai's Airoli
159.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) has introduced a new bus route to Thane's Bhiwandi from Airoli in Navi Mumbai. The bus service started on Monday (August 1) and frequency of the service is 25 to 30 minutes, as per reports. The places that come in the new route are Airoli, Thane, Majiwada, Bhiwandi Bypass and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Chowk.

160.title: Oppo, Vivo India & Xiaomi served notices for alleged tax evasion: Sitharaman
160.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed Rajya Sabha that three Chinese mobile companies- Oppo, Vivo India and Xiaomi have been served notices for alleged tax evasion by them. She said, while Oppo has been sent a notice for total customs duty of ₹4,389 crore, three show-cause notices have been issued to Xiaomi for an approximate duty liability of about ₹653 crore.

161.title: I sacrificed stardom to get freedom to cater to audience I wanted: Abhay
161.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol has stated that he had to sacrifice his stardom to be allowed the freedom to cater to the audience he wanted. He said that he was told to take advantage of the image of the Deol family. "Even though I did the films I did, it's difficult to...be constantly pushing because...filmmaking is a collective process," Abhay added.

162.title: Disappointing to lose film to A-lister who didn't even audition: Harleen
162.article_body: Actress Harleen Sethi stated that it's disappointing to lose a Bollywood film to an A-lister after being locked for six months. "I...get messages from directors saying, 'It was the best audition and you were the closest'," she said. The actress added that it happened recently when an A-lister got her part without even giving an audition or a look test.

163.title: Telecom sector may see ₹2-3 trillion investment in next 2 yrs: Vaishnaw
163.article_body: Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said India's telecom industry is likely to see investment of ₹2-3 trillion in next two years as reforms by the government have removed uncertainty and risks. "It's going to be significant investment by the industry," he said. Vaishnaw added that he's sure that the trend of affordable services will continue as operators start launching 5G services.

164.title: 99% of Florida's turtles born female due to hotter summers: Study
164.article_body: According to study, 99% of turtles born in Florida in the past four years have turned out to be female, thanks to hotter summers. According to researchers, the sex of sea turtles depends on temperature of developing eggs. If a turtle's egg is incubated below 27.7°C, the hatchling will be male, but if it's incubated above 31°C, it'll be female.

165.title: 2 held for theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 cr in Mumbai, 1 absconding
165.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested two diamond brokers, Bharat Kandol and Amrut Bhai Patel, in connection with the theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 crore, an official said on Monday. The mastermind behind the crime, Kaushik Chovatila, is absconding, the official added. The accused allegedly contacted a diamond merchant, expressing interest in purchasing diamonds, after which they stole the stones.

166.title: 76-yr-old rapes minor by luring her with ₹10 in Chhattisgarh, held
166.article_body: Two men, including a 76-year-old, were arrested for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl multiple times by luring her with ₹10 in Chhattisgarh, police said on Tuesday. The incident came to light when a woman from the victim's neighbourhood saw her coming out of the houses of the two accused and informed her parents, Balodabazar kotwali SHO Yadumani Sidar said.

167.title: Muhammed Yahiya, Sreeshankar qualify for men's long jump final at CWG 2022
167.article_body: India's Muhammed Anees Yahiya and Sreeshankar Murali have qualified for the men's long jump final at CWG 2022. Sreeshankar topped the qualifying rounds with an 8.05m jump to advance to the final, while Anees Yahiya produced an effort of 7.68m to be ranked eighth overall. Notably, Sreeshankar was the only one to cross the 8m automatic qualifying mark.

168.title: Multi-million dollars worth of crypto stolen from crypto firm Nomad's 'bridge'
168.article_body: US crypto firm Nomad's 'bridge', a tool which allows users to transfer tokens between blockchains, has been hit with a multi-million dollar theft. According to blockchain researchers, $150-$190 million worth of users' cryptocurrencies, including ether and USDC, were stolen. Nomad tweeted that it was "aware of the incident" and was currently investigating it but didn't disclose the theft's value.

169.title: Disappointed with govt: Family of BSF constable killed in Congo
169.article_body: The family of the BSF head constable Shishupal Singh Bagadia, who was killed in Congo, has said that they are "disappointed" with the Rajasthan government as nobody shared proper information. "No one reached out... We know how we spent the last six-seven days, how difficult it was," Bagadia's wife Kamla Devi said in presence of PCC chief Govind Dotasra.

170.title: 3 rob food delivery executive of his scooter in Delhi, arrested
170.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly robbing a scooter from a food delivery executive in Delhi's Subhash Place area, police said on Tuesday. The complainant said that the accused tried to steal his phone and attacked him with a sharp object when he resisted. The accused escaped with his scooter when he fell down, the complainant added.

171.title: Drugs worth ₹15 cr seized in Assam's Karbi Anglong, 3 arrested
171.article_body: Police said three persons were arrested on Tuesday and different types of drugs worth ₹15 crore were seized from them in Assam's Karbi Anglong district. According to a senior police official, the accused were heading towards West Bengal's Siliguri from Manipur. The seizures include 380 gm of heroin, one kg of morphine and two kg of methamphetamine, the official added.

172.title: Slain al-Qaeda chief Zawahiri penned a poem for Karnataka girl over hijab issue
172.article_body: Al-Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri, who was killed in a US drone strike in Kabul on Sunday, had recently released a video in which he spoke on the issue of hijab in Karnataka's educational institutions. He also penned a poem praising Muskan Khan, the girl who gained popularity for confronting a group of boys who were opposed to girls wearing hijab.

173.title: India to extend extra $100 mn line of credit to Maldives: PM Modi
173.article_body: After a meeting with Maldives' President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih in New Delhi on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said that India will extend an additional $100 million line of credit to the island nation. "In the last few years, there has been a renewed vigor in the friendly relations between India and Maldives, our closeness has increased," PM Modi tweeted.

174.title: US deploys 4 warships near Taiwan amid Chinese warnings over House Speaker's visit
174.article_body: Four US Navy warships have been positioned in waters east of Taiwan amid repeated Chinese warnings over House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's imminent visit to the island nation. An aircraft carrier is among the four vessels that have been deployed in the Philippines Sea, a US Navy official confirmed to Reuters. The official, however, said these were "routine deployments".

175.title: Nation is proud of your achievement: Harbhajan on Shushila's CWG 2022 silver
