Bommai's remarks came after Congress and JD(S) targeted him for not visiting the homes of two Muslim men who were killed in Dakshina Kannada, even though he met the family of murdered BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru.

350.title: Chandigarh constable suspended after hitting helmetless biker
350.article_body: A constable of Chandigarh Police was suspended on Monday after CCTV footage showed him hitting a biker riding without helmet with his baton. A video of the incident was widely circulated on social media. The complainant stated he was forced to tell doctors that he sustained his injuries after falling from his motorcycle when he was taken for medical examination.

351.title: Pak helicopter carrying Army General, other officers goes missing
351.article_body: A Pakistani military helicopter with six people on board, including an Army General, went missing on Monday, the army said. The helicopter was on a flood relief operation in Balochistan when it lost contact with air traffic control (ATC), it added. Calling the incident "alarming", PM Shehbaz Sharif said the entire nation is praying for the return of those onboard.

352.title: We nearly made a mess of this as well: Pooran after win in final over vs India
352.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said that "a win is a win" after they secured victory in the second T20I against India in the 20th over of their innings. "We lost a few close games and nearly made a mess of this as well," he stated. WI chased down India's 138-run total with only four balls remaining in the game.

353.title: Agra youth jumps into Yamuna river after failing to get govt job
353.article_body: A youth jumped into the Yamuna river after failing to secure a government job on Sunday night, police said. The man, who was a resident of Agra, was also preparing for army recruitment. Police stated that he left a note on his WhatsApp status before jumping into the river. A search is on to recover his body.

354.title: 2 people arrested for killing realtor in Hyderabad's Madhapur
354.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Monday arrested two men who may have fired upon and killed realtor Mohammed Ismail in Hyderabad's Madhapur. The two, identified as Jilani and Feroz, were nabbed on the outskirts of Hyderabad. However, the prime accused in the case, Mujahid, is currently on the run. According to police, there were property disputes between the accused and deceased.

355.title: Leaders from rival group shouldn't play with Shiv Sainiks' sentiments: Anita Birje
355.article_body: Shiv Sena's newly appointed deputy leader Anita Birje on Monday said that leaders from the rival group should not play with the sentiments of Shiv Sainiks, who will rise to the occasion if anyone tries to do so. "We will follow the path set by late Shiv Sena supremo Balasaheb Thackeray, with 80% social work and 20% politics," Birje added.

356.title: 3 police officers threaten lawyer, extort ₹9 lakh in Gurugram; held
356.article_body: The Gurugram Police have arrested three police personnel, including a special police officer, for allegedly extorting ₹9 lakh from a lawyer, officials said. The complainant claimed that he was at a guest house when at least five people, including the police personnel, arrived there, took him hostage, threatened to lodge a false case against him and demanded money.

357.title: Mumbai's madrassa teacher sold stolen mobiles in Nepal, Bangladesh; held
357.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 32-year-old man who is one of the seven gang members involved in auctioning stolen mobiles to resellers from Nepal and Bangladesh after changing the IMEI numbers. The accused had a bank account in Nepal and used to work as an Urdu teacher at a madrassa in Kurla. He was part of 43 WhatsApp groups.

358.title: Elon Musk is planning to build his own private airport in Texas: Report
358.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk is reportedly planning to build his own private airport in Texas. As per the report, the airport will be used by Musk and his executives. Musk has based several of his companies, including SpaceX and The Boring Company, in Texas, and moved his Tesla headquarters from Silicon Valley to Texas in December.

359.title: Pelosi has right to visit Taiwan, China needn't turn it into a conflict: US
359.article_body: The White House has warned China against turning US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's potential visit to Taiwan into a "crisis or conflict", saying Pelosi "has the right to visit Taiwan". The White House also warned China might respond to Pelosi's mooted visit to Taiwan with military provocations, including by firing missiles near Taiwan. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

360.title: Love it when people think 'She's so dumb', memes add to my popularity: Alia
360.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she loves it when people think that she is unintelligent or that "Oh, she is so dumb". "They make so many memes on me which add to [my] popularity...I also want to put out this message for young girls...general knowledge and bookish intelligence in my opinion is not intelligence," she added.

361.title: In-laws harass woman for not giving birth to boy in Pune; FIR filed
361.article_body: Pune's Chinchwad police have filed an FIR against a 28-year-old woman's in-laws for allegedly harassing and molesting her for not giving birth to a boy, officials said on Monday. The woman rushed to police to file a complaint following an incident on July 29, wherein she was apparently grabbed by her hair, beaten, verbally abused and molested by her in-laws.

362.title: I don't take this seriously: Kareena on 'Boycott Laal...' Twitter trend
362.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of her upcoming movie 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Everyone has an opinion...if that is going to be there, then you have to learn to ignore certain things," she stated. Kareena added, "Otherwise, it'll...become impossible to live your life...that's why I don't take any of this like seriously."

363.title: I worked in many factories, tea stalls when I was young: Sudesh Lehri
363.article_body: Comedian Sudesh Lehri, recalling his childhood, revealed that he had circumstances when he was in poverty. "I used to work in small shops when I was young. I've worked in...many factories, tea stalls," he stated. Sudesh added he used to "quietly" have some tea before giving it to factory workers as there were days he couldn't have tea at home.

364.title: I've written to Tom Hanks if he's free & would watch 'Laal...': Aamir
364.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan revealed that he has written to Hollywood actor Tom Hanks if he would like to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The film is an official remake of Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "I've written to him if he's free...would like to watch the film. I have got feedback from his team that they're seeing his schedule for that," he stated.

365.title: Burglars drill hole in wall of jewellery shop in Pune, steal ornaments
365.article_body: Burglars stole gold ornaments worth ₹2.96 lakh by drilling a hole in the wall of a jewellery shop in Pune's Undri, police said. They entered the premises of a school, adjacent to the shop, and drilled a hole in the common wall, police added. The burglars also stole the digital video recorder in which the CCTV footage was captured.

366.title: Who was al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan?
366.article_body: Al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, 71, was a key architect behind multiple assaults on the US and was "deeply involved" in the planning of the September 11, 2001 attacks that killed 3,000 people. Born in 1951, he grew up in Egypt's upper-class neighbourhood. Zawahiri, a trained surgeon, became al Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

367.title: Suryakumar, Avesh wear Arshdeep’s jersey in 2nd T20I against West Indies, pics go viral
367.article_body: India cricketers Suryakumar Yadav and Avesh Khan were seen wearing Arshdeep Singh's jersey during the second T20I against West Indies. This came after the match was postponed twice due to logistics issues, with luggage not arriving on time. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "How many extra jerseys does he have?" Another tweet read, "Why are everyone wearing Arshdeep's jersey?"

368.title: Partha Chatterjee not cooperating, often complaining of tiredness: ED
368.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said that ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the federal anti-money laundering agency in school job scam, has not been cooperating with sleuths. "He is often complaining of tiredness and avoiding our questions," an ED official told PTI. He remained silent most of the time during the questioning, the central probe agency added.

369.title: West Indies' McCoy breaks record for best-ever bowling figures against India in a T20I
369.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy has broken the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 to set the record. Prior to him, no bowler had even taken a five-wicket haul against India in T20I cricket. McCoy's figures against India are also the best-ever T20I figures by a West Indies bowler.

370.title: Who are India's gold medal contenders at CWG 2022 for today?
370.article_body: India's Seema Punia and Navjeet Kaur Dhillon will participate in women's discus throw final on Day 5 of CWG 2022. India will face Malaysia in gold medal match of badminton mixed team event at 10 pm. India's lawn bowls women's fours final match will begin at 4.15 pm. India's table tennis men's team gold match will begin at 6 pm.

371.title: Violation of withdrawal agreement: Taliban as US strike in Kabul kills al-Qaeda chief
371.article_body: After the US announced that it has killed Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri in a drone strike in Afghanistan over the weekend, Taliban condemned it as a violation of "international principles" and the 2020 agreement on US troop withdrawal. Taliban spokesperson Zabihullah Mujahid said in a statement that the attack took place in Kabul on Sunday.

372.title: Air India brings new policy to allow pilots to fly till 65 amid fleet expansion
372.article_body: Air India has introduced a new policy wherein selected pilots will be given an extension of five years on a contract basis after their retirement amid the airline increasing number of aircraft in its fleet. While currently, the pilots retire at 58 at the company, the contract can be extended till the age of 65 years.

373.title: I have faced 'extreme misogyny' and 'casual sexism': Alia Bhatt
373.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she has faced "casual sexism" and "extreme misogyny" in the past, which has made her much more sensitive. "Sometimes my friends go like '...why have you become so aggressive?'" added Alia. "It's...just random things like 'don't be so sensitive'...are you PMSing. To hell with you...and even if I am PMSing so the hell what?" she stated.

374.title: Bengaluru reports 992 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
374.article_body: Bengaluru reported 992 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,37,060 cases in the city, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall death toll remained at 16,975. The number of active cases was 8,325, while the infection positivity rate stood at 7.45%.

375.title: Loudspeaker which rang everyday at 8 am has stopped: Maharashtra CM
375.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday, without taking anyone's name, said the "loudspeaker" which rang everyday at 8 am is now stopped. "Hey, is...sound coming? Fix that loudspeaker. There'll be no sound," Shinde said. Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED on Sunday night after questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

376.title: Locals protest as minister says B'luru will be free of stray dogs
376.article_body: Weeks after Minister of Animal Husbandry Prabhu Chauhan said that Bengaluru will soon be free of stray dogs, locals held a protest at Freedom Park against the statement on Sunday. Calling the minister's claim misleading, Sujata Prasanna, a member of Action for Animal Justice, said there is no facility in the city that can accommodate lakhs of dogs.

377.title: Woman, 7-yr-old son returning from hospital run over by BEST bus, killed
377.article_body: A 27-year-old woman and her seven-year-old son were killed after being run over by a Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport (BEST) bus on Monday. Woman had taken her son to Sion hospital as he was suffering from cold, fever and cough for last two days. Reports said the victims did not see bus as it took sudden turn on road.

378.title: Who won medals for India at CWG 2022 on Day 4?
378.article_body: India won three medals on Day 4 of CWG 2022. Judoka Shushila Devi clinched a silver medal in the women's 48-kg category, becoming the first Indian to win multiple medals in judo in CWG history. Meanwhile, judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged bronze in the men's 60-kg category. Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category.

379.title: No matter where you hide, US will find you and take you out: Biden to terrorists
379.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "No matter where you hide, if you're a threat to our people, the United States will find you and take you out." He added, "We shall never waver from defending our nation and its people." Biden's statement came as he announced that Al-Qaeda's Ayman al-Zawahiri had been killed in a CIA drone strike in Afghanistan.

380.title: Estee Lauder in talks to acquire Tom Ford for $3 billion or more: Report
380.article_body: Cosmetics company Estee Lauder is in talks to acquire luxury brand Tom Ford in what could be a $3 billion or more deal, as per a report. If the deal goes through, it will be Estee Lauder's biggest acquisition ever. Tom Ford is known for its menswear and also has women's wear, cosmetics and handbags as part of its products.

381.title: Thane girl who scored 81.60% in SSC despite battling cancer passes away
381.article_body: Divya Pavale from Thane, who scored 81.60% despite battling cancer during her SSC exams this year, passed away on Monday evening. Reports said that Divya was undergoing chemotherapy even a few days before her practical exams. A trustee of her school said that she was a happy-go-lucky girl and was going through a difficult phase for last few days.

382.title: Delhi to launch mobile health check-ups for workers at construction sites
382.article_body: Delhi government has decided to set up mobile health check-ups and creche facilities for workers at construction sites. The 'Doctors on Wheels' scheme will arrange for mobile vans in every district to visit various construction sites for routine health check-ups, the government said. The mobile creches will be set up for children of construction workers at work sites, it added.

383.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 9 medals?
383.article_body: India have bagged a total of nine medals at CWG 2022 so far and are placed sixth on the medal standings after Day 4. Australia lead the standings with 31 gold medals, followed by England (21) and New Zealand (13). As many as 26 nations/territories have clinched at least one medal at CWG 2022 so far.

384.title: WI take all 10 wickets vs India in a T20I for 1st time in history, level series 1-1
384.article_body: West Indies defeated India by five wickets in the second T20I to level the five-match series 1-1. Bowling first, West Indies dismissed India for 138 runs in 19.4 overs. This is the first time in men's T20I cricket history that West Indies took all 10 wickets against India in an innings. West Indies chased down the target in 19.2 overs.

385.title: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan
385.article_body: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a drone strike by the US' CIA in Afghanistan on Sunday, President Joe Biden said. Zawahiri was a key plotter of the 9/11 terrorist attacks and took over as leader of the group after Osama bin Laden's death in 2011. "Justice has been delivered, and this terrorist leader is no more," Biden said.

386.title: Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bags bronze, wins India's 9th medal at CWG 2022
386.article_body: Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category, taking India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to nine. Harjinder lifted a total of 212 kg, with 93 kg in snatch and 119 kg in clean and jerk. Out of India's nine medals at CWG 2022 so far, seven have come from weightlifting.

387.title: Defending champions India qualify for badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022
387.article_body: Defending champions India have qualified for the badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022. With this, India are assured of another medal. India defeated Singapore 3-0 in the semi-final of the event.  India will face Malaysia in the final on Tuesday. India have so far bagged eight medals at CWG 2022, including three gold medals.

388.title: India draw 4-4 vs England, concede 3 goals in 4th quarter in CWG men's hockey
388.article_body: Indian men's hockey team was held to a 4-4 draw against England in their second Pool B match at the Commonwealth Games on Monday. India were 4-1 ahead before England scored three goals in the fourth quarter. During the match, India reached a milestone of 100 goals in Commonwealth Games history following Mandeep Singh's goal in the 22nd minute.

389.title: Arunachal suspends residential proof certificates in Changlang
389.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh government on Monday issued an order suspending all residential proof certificates (RPC) issued in the Changlang district of the state. RPCs have been issued to members of the Chakma and Hajong communities who are yet to get Indian citizenship. This comes after students' body AAPSU threatened a strike over RPCs being issued to the two communities in Changlang.

390.title: Death toll due to floods in eastern Uganda rises to 24
390.article_body: The death toll due to the floods triggered by torrential rains in eastern Uganda reached 24 on Monday, authorities and Ugandan Red Cross informed. Uganda's government had confirmed 10 deaths due to the flooding in parts of Bugisu, Mbale and Kapchorwa on Sunday. 21 bodies have been recovered from Mbale and another three from Kapchorwa, Ugandan Red Cross told media.

391.title: Fintech startup Tartan raises $4.5 mn in pre-Series A round
391.article_body: Payroll management startup Tartan has raised $4.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The round saw participation from 500 Global, InfoEdge Ventures, Naval Ravikant-backed AngelList Quant Fund, WorldQuant Ventures, Varanium GenNext Fund, 9 Unicorns, Yatra Angel Network, Emphasis Ventures (EMVC) and Naveen Kukreja. Tartan was founded in 2021 and has raised $6 million.

392.title: Inmates in Meerut jail make flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
392.article_body: Ahead of the 75th Independence Day, inmates of Meerut district jail have been making the national flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Jail superintendent Rakesh Kumar said that 30 male and 10 female inmates are making the flags. He further added that the national flag will be hoisted in all 39 barracks of the jail as part of the campaign.

393.title: TaxBuddy parent firm SSBA Innovations files ₹105 cr IPO papers
393.article_body: SSBA Innovations, which runs tax portal TaxBuddy, has filed papers with market regulator SEBI to raise ₹105 crore through an Initial Public Offering (IPO). As per the Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP), the IPO will be an entirely fresh issue of shares. The fintech company was incorporated in 2017 and owns two platforms — TaxBuddy and Finbingo.

394.title: Sushila Devi's CWG 2022 silver can start a big movement: Charu Sharma
394.article_body: Following Indian judoka Sushila Devi's silver medal at Commonwealth Games 2022, commentator Charu Sharma tweeted, "India's northeast has massive martial arts potential in the lighter weights. Sushila Devi proves it with a rare silver in Judo. Could start a big movement." The 27-year-old from Manipur won silver in 48 kg category on Monday in Birmingham.

395.title: Elon feels he's behind schedule, is frustrated with his progress: Father Errol Musk
395.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol has said that his billionaire son "feels like he's behind schedule", adding, "Where he is now, he would have liked to have been there five years ago." He added that the SpaceX CEO is "not as happy as he'd like to be", adding, "He is frustrated with (his) progress and it's understandable."

396.title: Kohli would be amazing to adventure with: Grylls on who he wants on Man vs Wild
396.article_body: On being asked who he would like to have on his show 'Man vs Wild', British adventurer Bear Grylls said, "Virat Kohli would be amazing to adventure with, a true heart of a lion and kind spirit." Grylls has earlier hosted Prime Minister Narendra Modi, actors Rajinikanth and Ranveer Singh and other Indian celebrities on the show.

397.title: Sri Lanka's Navy rescues 6 Indian fishermen stranded in its waters
397.article_body: Sri Lanka's Navy on Monday rescued six Indian fishermen after their boat developed a mechanical snag and drifted into the country's territorial waters. The Indian boat's owner was contacted by the Sri Lankan Navy, ANI reported. The owner then dispatched a rescue vessel from Rameswaram that brought back the stranded boat and its crew, the report added.

398.title: Ukraine confirms latest delivery of rocket systems from Germany, US
398.article_body: Ukraine's defence minister on Monday confirmed the latest delivery of German and US-made multiple rocket launcher systems to the country. Ukraine has received four HIMARS rocket launchers as part of the latest weapons aid, he said. He also announced on Twitter, "The third brother in the Long Hand family - MLRS MARS II from Germany - has arrived in Ukraine."

399.title: Nigerian man tests positive for monkeypox in Delhi, 6th case in India
399.article_body: A Nigerian man in his 30s has tested positive for monkeypox in Delhi, hospital officials said on Monday. This is the second case of the virus in the national capital and the sixth in India. The man had no recent foreign travel history, officials of the LNJP hospital, where he was admitted, said. India today confirmed its first monkeypox death.

400.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against West Indies
400.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the second T20I in St Kitts. India have made one change to their playing XI, with leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi being replaced by Avesh Khan. Meanwhile, West Indies have made two changes to their playing XI. The match was delayed due to logistics issues.

401.title: 28-year-old man dies in AC explosion in Chennai
401.article_body: A 28-year-old Chennai man died after an air conditioner exploded in his house on Sunday night. A loud noise was heard from the deceased's room on Sunday night, following which his father and brother rushed to the spot, reports said. They broke the door open and found the deceased's body inside the room, reports added.

402.title: Bill introduced in Aus parliament to lift ban on assisted suicides
402.article_body: A bill proposing the reversal of a ban on doctor-assisted suicide in two Australian territories was introduced in the country's parliament on Monday. It seeks to legalise assisted suicide in the Northern Territory and Australian Capital Territory. In 1995, Northern Territory became world's first place to legalise voluntary euthanasia. The law was later overturned in 1997 by Australia's parliament.

403.title: Vijay Kumar Yadav clinches bronze in judo, takes India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to 8
403.article_body: Indian judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged a bronze medal in men's 60-kg category at CWG 2022. With this, he took India's medal tally at CWG to eight. It is India's second medal in judo at the ongoing games after Shushila Devi's silver. India have bagged three gold medals, three silver medals and two bronze medals at CWG 2022 so far.
